thread.title: DALLAS COWBOYS, AMERICAN ACADEMY OF DERMATOLOGY UNITE TO TACKLE SKIN CANCER WITH FREE SCREENINGS AT
thread.title_full: DALLAS COWBOYS, AMERICAN ACADEMY OF DERMATOLOGY UNITE TO TACKLE SKIN CANCER WITH FREE SCREENINGS AT

title: DALLAS COWBOYS, AMERICAN ACADEMY OF DERMATOLOGY UNITE TO TACKLE SKIN CANCER WITH FREE SCREENINGS AT
text:
8:00 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 Categories 
Events, Sports For the second consecutive year, the American Academy of Dermatology is partnering with the Dallas Cowboys to promote skin cancer prevention and detection to the public. The Academy will be offering free SPOTme® skin cancer screenings with local board-certified dermatologists during the Cowboys Rally Day on Saturday, Oct. 10. Screening participants will be eligible to win autographed Cowboys memorabilia. Board-certified dermatologists will provide a visual inspection of exposed skin areas. SPOTme® skin cancer screenings will take place in a private booth on the sideline. An estimated 2,410 new cases of melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer, are expected to be diagnosed in Texas this year. Although skin cancer can affect anyone, men ages 50 and older have a higher risk of developing melanoma than the general population. Skin cancer is highly treatable when detected early, but it is still estimated that 9,940 people in the United States will die from melanoma this year. By encouraging fan participation in the free SPOTme® skin cancer screenings, the Academy and the Cowboys aim to save lives by educating the public about skin cancer prevention and detection. Visit SPOTme.org for additional information and valuable resources. MEDIA OPP: We encourage you to invite your audience to attend the free SPOTme® skin cancer screenings during the Dallas Cowboys Rally Day on Saturday, Oct. 10. If you would like to record on-site and/or conduct interviews, please contact Tessa Rossi at 312-240-3119. All media requests must be approved ahead of the event. About The American Academy of Dermatology Headquartered in Schaumburg, Ill., the American Academy of Dermatology, founded in 1938, is the largest, most influential, and most representative of all dermatologic associations. With a membership of more than 18,000 physicians worldwide, the Academy is committed to: advancing the diagnosis and medical, surgical and cosmetic treatment of the skin, hair and nails; advocating high standards in clinical practice, education, and research in dermatology; and supporting and enhancing patient care for a lifetime of healthier skin, hair and nails. SPOT Skin Cancer™ is the Academy’s campaign to create a world without skin cancer through public awareness, community outreach programs and services, and advocacy that promote the prevention, detection and care of skin cancer. For more information, contact the Academy at 1-888-462-DERM (3376) or www.aad.org. Follow the Academy on Facebook (American Academy of Dermatology), Twitter (@AADskin) or YouTube (AcademyofDermatology).
